result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory C Maier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Restitution of $4,412.81 to Ground Maintenance Services and $658.50 to Auto House (total of $5,071.31)
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

AS OF 11/02/2016: Additional restitution to be added in: $171.89 (Piggly Wiggly)

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations. DNA and costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school

No contact with victims or businesses listed in the complaint and in the cases 16CM82 and 16CF53.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Cases 16CF53 and 16CM82 were both dismissed and read into 16CF52.
